title: Dashboard Development
subtitle: Power BI dashboard and PowerPoint deck creation
content:
Dashboard & Presentation Development

Power BI dashboard and PowerPoint deck creation

Parallel Development Track

Days 8-22 (Parallel with Data Processing)

Note: Dashboard and PowerPoint development begins on Day 8 with sample data, running parallel to categorization to accelerate delivery.

Synchronized Development Process

Days 12-20

Daily Synchronization Workflow

Interactive Features (Power BI)

Days 18-22

Dashboard Architecture

Data Layer

  • Cleansed spend data
  • Master data tables
  • Calendar table
  • Exchange rates

Model Layer

  • Star schema design
  • Calculated columns
  • DAX measures
  • Row-level security

Visualization Layer

  • Executive summary
  • Spend analysis
  • Vendor analysis
  • Savings opportunities

Standard Dashboard Pages

1. Executive Summary

Total SpendVendor CountYoY GrowthSavings Identified

High-level metrics and trends for leadership

2. Spend Analysis

  • Spend by category
  • Spend by department
  • Monthly trends
  • Top categories drill-down

3. Vendor Analysis

  • Top vendors by spend
  • Vendor concentration
  • Single vs. sole source
  • Vendor performance metrics

4. Savings Opportunities

  • Consolidation opportunities
  • Contract compliance
  • Maverick spend
  • Payment term optimization

Key DAX Measures

// Essential DAX measures for spend analysis

// Total Spend
Total Spend = SUM(FactSpend[Amount_USD])

// Year-over-Year Growth
YoY Growth % = 
VAR CurrentYear = CALCULATE([Total Spend], YEAR(Date[Date]) = YEAR(TODAY()))
VAR PriorYear = CALCULATE([Total Spend], YEAR(Date[Date]) = YEAR(TODAY())-1)
RETURN 
DIVIDE(CurrentYear - PriorYear, PriorYear, 0)

// Vendor Count
Vendor Count = DISTINCTCOUNT(FactSpend[Vendor_ID])

// Top 80% Vendors (Pareto)
Top 80% Vendor Count = 
VAR TotalSpend = [Total Spend]
VAR VendorTable = 
    ADDCOLUMNS(
        VALUES(DimVendor[Vendor_ID]),
        "VendorSpend", [Total Spend]
    )
VAR RankedVendors = 
    ADDCOLUMNS(
        VendorTable,
        "RunningTotal",
        SUMX(
            FILTER(VendorTable, [VendorSpend] >= EARLIER([VendorSpend])),
            [VendorSpend]
        )
    )
RETURN 
    COUNTROWS(FILTER(RankedVendors, [RunningTotal] <= TotalSpend * 0.8))

// Maverick Spend
Maverick Spend = 
CALCULATE(
    [Total Spend],
    FactSpend[Has_PO] = FALSE(),
    FactSpend[Contract_ID] = BLANK()
)

Dashboard Development Checklist

Visualization Best Practices

Color Scheme

  • Use consistent colors for categories
  • Limit to 5-7 colors per visual
  • Use red for negative variances only
  • Apply corporate branding

Chart Selection

  • Bar charts for comparisons
  • Line charts for trends
  • Pie charts sparingly (max 5 slices)
  • Tables for detailed data

Performance

  • Limit visuals to 8 per page
  • Use aggregations where possible
  • Implement incremental refresh
  • Optimize DAX measures

PowerPoint Deck Structure

Standard Slide Flow (15-20 slides)

  1. Title Slide - Project name, date, team
  2. Executive Summary - Key findings and recommendations
  3. Agenda - Topics covered
  4. Spend Overview - Total spend, trends, distribution
  5. Category Analysis - Top categories, YoY changes
  6. Vendor Landscape - Concentration, top vendors
  7. Savings Opportunities - Identified savings by category
  8. Deep Dive: IT Spend - Detailed category analysis
  9. Deep Dive: Professional Services - Detailed analysis
  10. Recommendations - Action items prioritized
  11. Implementation Roadmap - Timeline for initiatives
  12. Appendix - Supporting data and methodology

Dashboard Publishing

Deployment Process

  1. Workspace Setup
    • Create dedicated workspace
    • Set permissions and access
    • Configure refresh schedule
  2. Dataset Configuration
    • Set up gateway connection
    • Configure incremental refresh
    • Test data refresh
  3. Report Publishing
    • Publish from Power BI Desktop
    • Create app for end users
    • Set up email subscriptions

Pro Tip: Always create a 'Data Quality' page in your dashboard showing completeness metrics, last refresh time, and any data issues. This builds trust with users.
